{"step_by_step_thinking": "Vitamin C, also known as ascorbic acid, is an essential nutrient for humans. It is not synthesized by the human body and must be obtained through the diet. The synthesis of vitamin C in humans involves several enzymatic steps. The final step in the synthesis pathway is the conversion of L-gulonolactone to ascorbic acid. This conversion is catalyzed by the enzyme L-gulonolactone oxidase. Therefore, the correct answer is C. L-Gulonolactone oxidase.", "answer_choice": "C"}
